metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29957 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
If a MIME encoded email contains an OpenPGP inline signed or encrypted message part, but also contains an additional unprotected part, Thunderbird did not indicate that only parts of the message are protected. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 78.10.2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-29957` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2').
